ygData.subject: Re: Rathe Mountains
ygData.msgSnippet: hello all I am new to the list (like the last few days)...and unfortunately I think I missed this message that he is referring to saying thanks for the tip.
ygData.messageBody:
hello all
I am new to the list (like the last few days)...and unfortunately I
think I missed this message that he is referring to saying thanks for
the tip. would someone be so kind as to repeat it or even send it to
me privately? I would be most interested as I love to fight in the
Rathe mountains but I have yet to ever make that kind of money....what
are you doing? As well I should point out that I am a druid but I just
started a bard and I love her. she just made level 6 and I think that
the best thing about being a bard is having something to look forward
to at each level instead of every 5 like most classes. I thank you all
for your indulgence.

Crysarra Windblade
Chisarra de'Danaan

--- kim@... wrote:
> Wow, thanks for the tip on clearing the "trash" mobs from the
> hills here to get giants to spawn. I made over 350pp there
> tonight, and each of my friends there made over 200pp (I was
> soloing a couple hours before the others showed up). I think
> my guild raked in close to 2000pp for the night, as well as 8
> or 9 lambent stones. Now if they'll just fix Genni...
>
> This place is a high level bard's dream. Lots of open space
> to run around in, great cash loot, merchants nearby so you can
> sell the heavy weapons, etc. The only down side was that I
> died once. I had two giants fighting each other, then charm
> was resisted 4 times in a row, I accidently let Accelerando
> drop, and got chain-stunned 3 times, which was long enough for
> both giants to kill me. My group wasn't able to get within
> range to heal me in time.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
>
>
------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> toren@... with the subject lol.
>
<HR>

>
